summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 25, 2019, discussing victim notification procedures in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's upcoming arrest by the SDNY. It outlines coordination between FBI personnel and the U.S. Attorney's Office to compile and manage victim information for rights notification.

persons.name: Sean Watson
persons.role: FBI personnel (excluded from victim information distribution)
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who should be excluded from receiving the compiled victim information from the SDNY.

events.title: FBI Coordination for Epstein Arrest
events.description: FBI personnel discuss internal procedures for victim notification in anticipation of an upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein by the SDNY.

events.title: Planned SDNY Press Release and Victim Hotline
events.description: The email references an upcoming SDNY press release and an 800-number hotline for victims of Jeffrey Epstein to self-identify after his arrest.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively preparing for Jeffrey Epstein's arrest by the SDNY as of June 25, 2019, indicating advanced knowledge of the operation.
A key procedural goal was to compile a victim list from the SDNY to notify victims of their rights 'ASAP' following the arrest.
The email stresses the importance of collecting complete guardian information for minor victims to enable contact, highlighting the involvement of minors in the case.
The correspondence shows coordination between the FBI's Victim Services and the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) on victim management for a 'higher profile case'.
The document references the FBI's Victim Notification System (VNS) and Sentinel system as tools for tracking and contacting victims.
